GeneralInformation.Vice Principal (Admin): MR DALBIR SINGH S/O SURAT SINGH
GeneralInformation.School Vision: A Community of Learners, Leaders and Innovators.
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Growing Today for where the World is Going Tomorrow.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The school believes that every member of the school community must strive to be an engaged learner, an inspiring leader and an ethical innovator in order to be work-ready and world-ready in the future. The school values, Teamwork, Respect, Responsibility, Integrity and Pride, are the cornerstones that nurture a strong culture of care, excellence and innovation that are critical to the attainment of the school vision. The school programmes are designed to ensure that students are developed holistically in both academics and character, and they are closely aligned to the school motto, 'Pursuit of Knowledge, Service to All'.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.STEM: Developing inquiring minds and creative learners through Arduino
School Distinctive Programmes.Music & Performing Arts: Character Development through the Arts, Media and Design

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The Learning for Life Programme (LLP-Character Development through Arts, Media & Design) provides: (i) Arts Foundation classes including Drama, Choir, Band and Dance and (ii) Enrichment classes including Drama, Hip Hop, 3D Animation, Film Video, Robotics, Interior Design and Mechatronics. The Applied Learning Programme (ALP-Developing Inquiring Minds and Creative Learners through Arduino) provides students with opportunities to see connections between academic knowledge and skills in the real world. Through ALP, students learn to develop innovative ideas and solutions for real-life problems. Other programmes include After-School Engagement Programme, Assertiveness Training Programme, Family Matters@School Programme, National Youth Achievement Award Programme, Philosophy for Children (P4C), Service Learning and Student Leadership. The school's curricular innovations include Bicultural Twinning and Immersion Exchange Programmes, Inquiry-based Learning, Normal (Technical) Learning Journeys and Work Attachment Programme.

2014.Special Awards: LHL Award for Innovation in the Normal Course
